For an archaeologist, it's the find of a lifetime, and Steve Dickinson, a tutor at Lancaster University in Northern England, hopes his hunches will prove correct and that he has found nothing less than the birthplace of Saint Patrick. 
 
 Saint Patrick is the beloved patron saint of the Irish and Scots-Irish people. His Feast Day of March 17 -- Saint Patrick's Day -- is one of the most popular on the calendar. According to legend, Patrick was born to Roman parents in Britain in 385. At age 16 he was captured by Irish pirates and underwent a series of visions while enslaved.
